meanings.definition: A class of alcohols containing multiple hydroxyl groups.
meanings.sent1: Polyols are compounds with more than one hydroxyl group.
meanings.sent2: Manufacturers use polyols in various products due to their unique chemical structure.
meanings.sent3: The polyols at the party were the hydroxyl group champions, always mingling with other compounds.
meanings.sent4: In the chemical world, polyols are like social butterflies with multiple hydroxyl friends.
meanings.sent5: Imagine polyols as molecules with multiple hydroxyl arms, ready to bond with other atoms.

meanings.definition: Sugar alcohols used as sweeteners in food products.
meanings.sent1: Some people prefer using polyols as sweeteners in their diet.
meanings.sent2: Polyols are commonly found in sugar-free candies and chewing gums.
meanings.sent3: The polyols in the dessert were the secret agents of sweetness, undercover as sugar substitutes.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was as sweet as the taste of polyols in the sugar-free treat.
meanings.sent5: The polyols danced on the taste buds, leaving a lingering sweetness behind.
